Wade Roberts Green Party Candidate For State Rep MI 109th There's only one candidate in this 2017 race for State Rep that is committed to full employment and a living minimum wage for everyone who wants or needs a job.   Continuing educational opportunities with a decentralized state university system offering college courses available at low cost or no cost in every county seat and full health care benefits, including dental and vision services for everyone, not just the 90% eligible for health insurance they can't afford to use and ...  are penalized for if they don't buy it. Cambensy hasn't taken a position on CR 595, which is safe.  There's no money for it now anyway and the EPA isn't budging without an expensive protracted legal battle.   Rich Rossway , who is against raising any taxes is going to fight for the 100 million dollar road through environmentally sensitive wilderness and wetlands. ...  If Marquette County can afford to spend 100 million on county roads, I support rebuilding some existing county roads and a drive from Little Lake to Carlsend and on towards US 41 from either direction would convince most there's a definite need.  As for spending 100 million of public funds to shorten the route of the mining interests looting the precious metals beneath what is yours and mine; I am opposed to it. ‚Äé Karen Weidner ‚Äé ¬† to ¬† Marcia Squier In Japan, gun homicides are so rare the likelihood of dying by firearm is equal to an American‚Äôs chance of being killed by lightning.   Still, President Donald Trump encourages people to look to guns as a means of protection. In a speech Monday, Trump called the Texas shooting a ‚Äúmental health problem‚Äù not a ‚Äúguns problem.‚Äù But Japan has almost eradicated gun crime in the country by putting requirements on gun sales that are similar to driver‚Äôs tests.   To own a gun in the country, a citizen must attend an all-day class and perform at least 95 percent on a shooting-range test, as well as pass a written exam. They‚Äôre also required to pass drug tests and mental health tests. In 2014 there were just six gun deaths in Japan, while there were 33,599 in the United States. At the same time, off-duty police aren‚Äôt permitted to carry their firearm, and when they must subdue a suspect, they use a combination of martial arts or striking weapons, Business Insider reported.   Still, Trump wants to see more guns.
